discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Tableau Repository: This is the central location within Tableau for storing and managing various workbook-related elements, including custom shapes.
Shapes Directory: This specific folder within the Repository is designed to hold the custom shapes that you want to use within your Tableau workbooks.

questions.question_text:
A Data Analyst decides to add custom shapes to some key performance indicators (KPIs) in order to indicate their performance.

How should the analyst make the custom shapes available in a workbook?

choices.C: Add the URL to the shapes in the Workbook Format menu.
choices.D: Copy the new shapes to the Shapes directory in My Tableau Prep Repository.
choices.A: Drag and drop the shapes into the Tableau workbook.
choices.B: Copy the new shapes to the Shapes directory in My Tableau Repository.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
ex: MIN([Name]) = "Abebi". First is a table calc

Selected Answer: A
CONTAINS: A string function that checks whether a specific substring exists within a string.
LEN: A string function that returns the length of a string.
MIN: While typically used as an aggregation function, it can also be applied to strings in some contexts (e.g., finding the lexicographically smallest string).

Selected Answer: A
Tested. The correct answer is A

questions.question_text: Which series of functions contains only string functions?

A Data Analyst applied a dimension filter to a worksheet with FIXED Level of Detail (LOD) calculations.

How does this filter affect the worksheet?

choices.A: The dimension filter alters the data displayed in the worksheet along with the FIXED LOD calculation.
choices.D: The dimension filter alters the data displayed in the worksheet but does not influence the FIXED LOD calculation.
choices.C: The dimension filter is carried out first before computing the FIXED LOD calculation.
choices.B: The dimension filter alters the data displayed in the worksheet before computing the FIXED LOD calculation.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
does not influence the FIXED LOD calculation.

Selected Answer: A
When LOD function used in the dimension filter it will filter along with LOD calculation

Filter - Select - Keep All Values
Show all values is wrong, as condition is to change the bar chart data when clicking on different city, which is only possible with Keep All Values. Show all values allows deselction of filter when clicking on same city again.

comments.content:
The Reveal Solution is wrong.
The wright solution is Filter > Select > Keep filtered Values

discussion.content:
The data in the bar chart must change only when the user selects a different city
=>
Filter--->Select ---> Keep filtered values
I think the correct options are Filter--->Select ---> Keep filtered values

Answer is Filter --> Select --> Show all values
Select on a city to filter and clicking else where shows all values.

Selected Answer: A
Dimensions in Tableau categorize data, and discrete dimensions are those that have distinct, separate values

A Data Analyst plans to add a top N filter.

Which field type should the analyst use to filter by in the top N filter?
